title: Vision page rewrite with AI→AI→human orchestration narrative and law-firm multi-step story

requirements.summary: Rewrite the Vision page so the primary narrative leads with humans requesting outcomes, AI agents orchestrating execution (including hiring other agents), and optionally hiring humans for real-world steps.
acceptanceCriteria: Vision page hero title remains “Vision” and the page remains the same route/component (frontend/src/pages/VisionPage.tsx).
The opening Vision narrative clearly leads with: humans request outcomes; agents orchestrate execution; agents may hire other agents; and real-world steps can be fulfilled by humans when needed.
Tone is marketing-friendly and accessible (minimal jargon), while still visionary and future-forward.
All updated user-facing text is in English.

file_operations.description: Rewrite the top-of-page narrative section(s) so the primary vision explicitly and prominently frames Forge as: humans request outcomes; agents execute and orchestrate; agents can hire/coordinate other agents; and when digital meets the real world, agents can optionally route discrete physical steps to humans (future-facing), while keeping the H1 text “Vision” unchanged.

requirements.summary: Add an explicit ordered multi-step storytelling section using a future law-firm scenario to illustrate AI+AI+human orchestration and proof/results returning to the requester.
acceptanceCriteria: The law-firm example is presented as an explicit, ordered multi-step narrative (not a single sentence or a brief parenthetical).
The story explicitly includes: coordination across multiple AI agents for the digital work, and hiring a human for the physical/real-world step (serving papers).
The section is written as illustrative/future-facing narrative copy and does not claim the capability is already live (it may describe it as a future state or “where this leads”).

file_operations.description: Add a dedicated Vision-page section that tells the future law-firm scenario as a clearly ordered 4-step story: (1) human requests legal action, (2) an orchestrating agent coordinates multiple specialized AI agents to research/cross-reference precedents and draft filings, (3) the agent hires a human for the real-world serving step, and (4) proof/results are returned to the requester; ensure the copy is explicitly future-facing (not presented as already live).

requirements.summary: Align updated Vision copy with Forge’s established terminology (execute/coordinate/orchestrate/settlement) and avoid introducing conflicting vocabulary or stronger claims about payments/escrow/settlement than elsewhere on the site.
acceptanceCriteria: Copy aligns with the established lexicon in frontend/src/content/lexicon.ts (preferred verbs and core terms) where applicable.

Any references to payments/escrow/settlement remain described at the same level of certainty as the rest of the site (no new claims of already-live on-chain escrow if not already claimed elsewhere on the page).

file_operations.description: Edit wording throughout the Vision page to prefer lexicon-aligned terms (e.g., “execute”, “coordinate”, “orchestrate”, “settlement”) and remove/replace conflicting synonyms where they create concept drift; review and soften/normalize any settlement/escrow phrasing so it does not introduce new certainty beyond the page/site’s existing claims.
